Examinations Department

Ensuring excellence and integrity in all assessments and certifications across CDACC, KNEC, NITA, and KTVC board examinations.

CDACC Certified
KNEC Approved
NITA Accredited
Examinations Officer

Mr. Paul Kimanzi

Bachelor of Education

Mr. Kimanzi brings experience in examination management and assessment coordination. He has been instrumental in establishing robust examination systems that maintain the highest standards of integrity and efficiency. His expertise spans across all major certification bodies in Kenya's TVET sector.

Programs Assessed

Examination Bodies We Work With

CDACC

Curriculum Development, Assessment and Certification Council

National body for curriculum development and assessment in TVET institutions.

Programs Managed:

  • Diploma Programs
  • Higher National Diploma
  • Advanced Certificate

KNEC

Kenya National Examinations Council

National examinations body conducting various technical and vocational assessments.

Programs Managed:

  • Technical Education Certificates
  • Trade Tests
  • Professional Courses

NITA

National Industrial Training Authority

Industrial training authority overseeing artisan and trade certification.

Programs Managed:

  • Artisan Certificates
  • Trade Tests
  • Skills Upgrading

KTVC Board

Kongoni Technical Vocational Training College Board

Internal board managing short courses and institutional certifications.

Programs Managed:

  • Short Courses
  • Professional Development
  • Continuing Education

Our Services

Examination Scheduling

Coordination of examination timetables across all certification bodies.

Assessment Management

Oversight of continuous assessment, practical exams, and final examinations.

Exam Security

Maintaining examination integrity through secure processes and protocols.

Results Processing

Efficient processing and release of examination results and certificates.

Documentation

Proper documentation and record keeping of all examination activities.

Student Support

Guidance and support for students throughout the examination process.

Important Guidelines

  • Registration for examinations closes 30 days before exam date
  • All examination fees must be paid before registration confirmation
  • Students must achieve 75% attendance to be eligible for examinations
  • Valid identification required for all examinations

Examination Process

1

Registration

Complete examination registration and pay required fees

2

Preparation

Attend revision sessions and complete coursework requirements

3

Examination

Sit for theory and practical examinations as scheduled

4

Results

Receive results and collect certificates upon completion

Contact Examinations Department

For examination inquiries, registration assistance, or result queries, please contact our office during business hours.
